criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: Are all required components present and comprehensive?

scores.1: Major components missing - skill has significant gaps in coverage
scores.2: Several important components missing or incomplete - limited utility
scores.3: Core components present but some supporting elements missing - adequate coverage
scores.4: Nearly complete with only minor gaps - good comprehensive coverage
scores.5: Exceptionally complete - all core and supporting components present with depth

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: Are instructions clear, unambiguous, and easy to understand?

scores.1: Instructions confusing or ambiguous - difficult to follow
scores.2: Some clarity but significant ambiguity remains - requires interpretation
scores.3: Generally clear with occasional ambiguity - mostly understandable
scores.4: Clear and well-explained with minimal ambiguity - easy to follow
scores.5: Crystal clear with excellent explanations and examples - no ambiguity

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: Can the skill be followed step-by-step and applied in practice?

scores.1: Theoretical only - no actionable steps or practical guidance
scores.2: Limited actionability - some steps but difficult to apply
scores.3: Adequately actionable - can be followed with some effort
scores.4: Highly actionable - clear steps and practical application guidance
scores.5: Exceptionally actionable - detailed steps, examples, and immediate applicability

criteria.name: Structure
criteria.description: Is the skill logically organized with clear navigation?

scores.1: Poorly organized - difficult to navigate, no clear structure
scores.2: Weak organization - some structure but hard to find information
scores.3: Adequately organized - logical structure, acceptable navigation
scores.4: Well organized - clear structure and easy navigation
scores.5: Exceptionally organized - intuitive structure, excellent navigation, linked resources

criteria.name: Examples
criteria.description: Are sufficient concrete examples provided to illustrate concepts?

scores.2: Minimal examples - insufficient to illustrate concepts clearly
scores.3: Adequate examples - covers main concepts with at least one example each
scores.4: Good examples - multiple concrete illustrations across most concepts
scores.5: Excellent examples - comprehensive concrete illustrations for all major concepts

criteria.name: Triggers
criteria.description: Is 'when to use' clearly defined with specific trigger conditions?

scores.1: No trigger conditions specified - unclear when to use
scores.2: Vague triggers - difficult to know when skill applies
scores.3: Adequate triggers - general guidance on when to use
scores.4: Clear triggers - specific conditions and scenarios well-defined
scores.5: Excellent triggers - comprehensive when/when-not guidance with concrete scenarios

criteria.name: Cognitive Foundation
criteria.description: Are cognitive psychology principles well-explained and properly applied?

scores.1: No cognitive foundation - purely prescriptive rules without explanation
scores.2: Weak cognitive foundation - limited explanation of underlying principles
scores.3: Adequate cognitive foundation - basic principles explained
scores.4: Strong cognitive foundation - principles well-explained with research backing
scores.5: Exceptional cognitive foundation - deep principles, research citations, WHY clearly explained
